document.text: WHEREAS, There is a vacan cy in the judgship of the Fifth Judicial Circuit of Virginia caus ed by the death of the late Honorable Joel W. Flood and WHEREAS, The Board of Sup ervisors of Appomattox County, Virginia, at a called meeting on the 1st day of May, 16, with all three of its members pre sent, desire to make recomenda- tion to His Excellency, the Gov- e. nor of Virginia, as to the fill ing of said vacancy. NOW,, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Supervisors of Appomattox Coun ty, Virginia, that the Board does hereby wholeheartedly endorse the Honorable George Abbitt, Jr. for appointment to fill the vac ancy in the Fifth Judicial Cir cuit of Virginia believing that he is eminently qualified by training, experience, demenor and temperament to fill said important post and the Board does urge the Honorable Albertis S. Harrison, Jr. to appoint the Honorabe George Abbitt, Jr. as Judge of the Fifth Judicial Cir cuit of Virginia. Otho W. Martin, Jr R. M. Webb John C. Cole

Abbitt for renomination and re-election to Congress from the Fourth District, introduced by Calvin Robinson and one endorsing the record of United States Senator Harry F. Byrd, in troduced by C. W. Smith. Congressman W. M. Abbitt was present and addressed the meeting. Charles F. P. Crawley served as the presiding officer of the meeting and C. W. Smith served as secretary. document.text: Ward Ashby Dean, for nearly 17 years a state probation and parole officer in the Lynchburg district, has been assigned to a new areaBedford and Frank lin counties and expects to transfer when a replacement has been appointed and trained for the vacancy. The Lynchburg district in cludes the counties of Amherst, A p p o m a t t o x , Buckingham, Cumberland and Nelson and also the City of Lynchburg, according to R. E. Jordan, of Lynchburg, chief probation and parole offi cer for the district. Dean, 46, whose home is in Bedford, has been serving the counties of Appomattox, Buck- i Ingham and Cumberland and the j City of Lynchburg in his official duties with the Circuit Courts and Parole Board. Applications to fill the vacancy created by Deans transfer are being received by Chief Proba tion and Parole Officer Jordan at the Old Courthouse on Court Street. Dean expects to remain on un til his replacement has been se lected and appointed, Jordan said. Dean will assist with the training of the new officer. The new probation and pa role officer must be approved by the judges of the courts of re cord within the area embraced by the Lynchburg District. These judges are Judge C. G. Quesenbery for Amherst and Nelson counties, Judge Cundiff for the City of Lynchburg, Judge George Abbitt, Jr., for Appcmat tox, Buckingham and Cumber lan dcounties, and Judge Swee ney for Campbell and Bedford counties. Jordan explained that the vol ume of cases has gown steadily in Bedford and Franklin coun ties in recent years, necessitat ing the addition of another offi cer to work with the Circuit Courts in those two counties. Dean is a Lynchburg College graduate who was a student at VPI before World War II. Dur ing the war he was an Army captain, serving four years and six months in tank destroyer forces. Dean taught school for a time at Huddleston, in Bedford Coun ty. He is married to the former Mary Burks of Bedford.
